intro: Micranthes nelsoniana var. reniformis, commonly known as the round-leafed micranthes, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
